concept.title: The Parts of a Command
concept.shortdesc: Each ConTeXt command must have a name, and may also take setups (either as keywords, keyval pairs, or sets of each) and can have a scope.

link.desc: A ConTeXt command is formed by a backslash (\) and a series of letters.
Commands can accept parameters. Collections of parameters that change the behavior of the command are setups. Setups come after the command in blocks, delimited into blocks by square brackets.
A command may have a scope as an argument. A comman's scope is delimited by curly braces ({ and }) after the command.
